One full time post deals with FOI in the central team, but also spends 
time working on other information governance matters from time to time. 
  
Other Information Governance Officers are involved in some FOI requests as 
the need arises. 
  
Across Council Service Areas, other officers are involved in collating 
information to respond to FOI requests, undertaking third party 
consultations, and identifying any exemptions to be considered by the 
Council's Exemption Panel. 
  
Exemption Panel meets once per week and is advised by a senior solicitor 
on a rota basis, so there is some time allocated by Legal Services to deal 
with FOI requests. 
  
In the event of an appeal, an FOI request will be re-looked at by an 
appropriate senior officer, usually a Head of Service, Director or 
sometimes the Chief Executive.

Security and Privacy Impact Assessments.
• Maintenance of KCC’s Record Retention Schedule
• Investigation of alleged Data Protection breaches in accordance with the
Information Security Incident Protocol.
• Maintenance of the Information Security Incident Log
• Safeguarding checks (social service background checks on people working with
children) for CAFCASS, OFSTED, independent fostering agencies, other local
authorities and other third party organisations
• Management and coordination of requests for information.
